extracted_entities.name: Special Issue on Innovative Frontiers in Automated Software Engineering

details.aims_and_scope: This special issue aims to collect contributions for innovative ideas, visionary perspectives, and critical reflections that can potentially reshape automated software engineering significantly.

types_of_papers.description: Groundbreaking new ideas supported by promising initial results.
Bold, forward-looking ideas that may not yet have solid results but are backed by strong scientific intuition.
Critical reassessments of current research directions and thoughtful analyses of key ideas in software engineeringâ€™s history.

topics_of_interest: Radical approaches to automating software engineering tasks supported by preliminary evidence
Novel applications of automation in software engineering contexts
Bold predictions about transformative directions in automated software engineering
The untapped potential of automation in emergent software domains and paradigms
Novel theoretical frameworks for rethinking fundamental aspects of automated software development
Reassessments of foundational assumptions in automated software engineering
Examination of ethical implications and unintended consequences
Reimagining correctness and verification in an era of AI-generated software
Novel approaches to handling uncertainty and ambiguity
Transformative applications of large language models
Radical new perspectives on software composition and integration
Disruptive ideas for automated testing, verification, and validation.
details.guest_editors: To be disclosed; contributions can be sent to SEWORLD.
